title: How to do bare-ankle weather dressing on a budget
text:
There’s a small window of time - approximately 10 weeks of the year - when I’m in my fashion happy place. It’s bright and sunny but there’s a definite chill in the air. From October to mid-November (and then again in the Spring), it’s bare ankle season, when all of my transeasonal favourites, like culottes and ballet flats, come into their own.

There’s no denying it’s a bit crisp out, but donning full winter gear too early will a) leave you bored and uninspired by your wardrobe come January, and b) mean you’ll be in tights for half of the year, which is slightly depressing and rather binding. Instead, I’d counsel you to make the most of this weather sweet spot.

Of course, I’m not sat at my desk...
